intro: Sapium biglandulosum f. minus, commonly known as the small-leaved Chinese lantern plant, is a variant of the Chinese lantern plant characterized by its reduced foliage. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to eastern Asia, particularly China. The plant features heart-shaped leaves that are smaller and more densely arranged compared to the typical form. Its most striking feature is the bright orange, lantern-like蒴果 that matures in late summer. This cultivar is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant.
